stories.text:
We are a small-ish (< 50 FTE) SaaS company in the education space. Was wondering what people were seeing as the best options for hiring talent. We've primarily done off-shore and still have a good continuing relationship with our vendor/team. We're at the point where it makes sense to bring some more expertise in house. We don't do anything special technically (react/ruby/postgres), but there are some things in our space that is better handled in-house (student-data, privacy, etc..).

My question is how are you as a small company able to find qualified candidates. Is the main driver just pay and remote work? What were some easy drivers for filtering out candidates? If you had a name unrecognizable to 99.9999% of applicants, how did you stand-out and make it seem attractive? Am I better off finding senior US-based devs who can hit the ground running through contract work / agencies?
stories.title: Developer hiring in 2022 – Small Bootstrapped SaaS
EinkBro's save-as-ePub feature is uncannily brilliant
